title: Whale Dominance
description: A quick, practical guide to Whale Dominance.

hook.text: In token-weighted voting, one whale can outvote thousands of small holders. Money equals power in DAOs.

buildup.text: Venture capital firms that invested early hold massive token positions. Their votes can override entire communities.

discovery.text: In some DAOs, the top 10 wallets control over 50% of all voting power. Decentralization exists on paper only.

twist.text: Quadratic voting â€” where voting power scales less than linearly â€” could reduce whale dominance. Few DAOs use it.

climax.text: Token-weighted governance recreated the inequalities DAOs were supposed to fix. Wealth still determines influence.

punchline.text: One token, one vote sounds fair â€” until one person holds millions.

quiz.question: How could quadratic voting reduce whale dominance?
options: By giving more tokens to small holders
By making voting power scale less than linearly with token holdings
